content: In the following questions, I will provide you with a graph (given as an array of nodes and an array of edges), a starting point, and a target point. Please return the shortest path from the starting point to the target point in the following format: 1->2->3->4... Please note that your answer should only include the result in this format and should not contain any other words.(Notice that for the same problem, even if the question is phrased differently, the conclusion should remain consistent.)

The shortest path from node 6 to node 13 is:

6 -> 11 -> 12 -> 13

Note: The graph and starting and destination nodes you provided are not sorted in any specific order, so the shortest path is calculated by following the path that minimizes the number of edges crossed. This path includes 6, then 11, then 12, and finally 13.

The shortest path from node 6 to node 13 is:

6 -> 7 -> 12 -> 13

Note: The graph and starting and destination nodes you provided are not sorted in any specific order, so the shortest path is calculated by following the path that minimizes the number of edges crossed. This path includes 6, then 7, then 12, and finally 13.
